title: KOALEMOS
content:
KOALEMOS (Coalemus) was the personified spirit (daimon) of stupidity and foolishness. His name was
        derived from the words koeô and êleos meaning "to hear foolishness."

Aristophanes, Birds 220 ff (trans. O'Neill) (Greek comedy C5th to 4th B.C.)
          :
        "Come, take a chaplet, offer a libation to Koalemos (Coalemus) the god of dtupidity and take care to fight
        vigorously."

Plutarch, Life of Cimon 4. 3 (trans. Perrin) (Greek historian C1st to C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "He [a man] had the bad name of being dissolute and bibulous, and of taking after his grandfather Kimon
        (Cimon), who, they say, because of his simplicity, was dubbed Koalemos (Coalemus), the Stupid-One."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
